articles.title: –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø–∞—Ä: 45+ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂–µ–π
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∞ –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂ –¥–æ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–æ–º–æ–≤–Ω–æ—ó –∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ ‚Äî —Ü–µ –Ω–µ–∑–∞–±—É—Ç–Ω—ñ–π –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥! –©–æ–± –≤–∞—à–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ–¥–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–π—à–ª–∞ –≥–ª–∞–¥–∫–æ, –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ –∑–Ω–∞—Ç–∏ –∫–ª—é—á–æ–≤—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –¥–ª—è —Ä—ñ–∑–Ω–∏—Ö —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü—ñ–π. –£ —Ü—å–æ–º—É –ø–æ—Å—ñ–±–Ω–∏–∫—É –≤–∏ –∑–Ω–∞–π–¥–µ—Ç–µ –≤—Å–µ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö—ñ–¥–Ω–µ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂—ñ —É–¥–≤–æ—Ö.

## –í –∞–µ—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É

<PhraseOfDay
  word="We're traveling together"
  translation="–ú–∏ –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂—É—î–º–æ —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ—Ä —Ç—Ä–µ–≤–µ–ª—ñ–Ω–≥ —Ç—É–≥–µ–∑–µ—Ä"
  context="–ö–æ—Ä–∏—Å–Ω–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—é, –∫–æ–ª–∏ –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂—É—î—Ç–µ –ø–∞—Ä–æ—é."
/>

### –†–µ—î—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è (Check-in)

<VocabCard
  word="We'd like to check in, please"
  translation="–ú–∏ —Ö–æ—Ç—ñ–ª–∏ –± –∑–∞—Ä–µ—î—Å—Ç—Ä—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ–¥ –ª–∞–π–∫ —Ç—É —á–µ–∫ —ñ–Ω, –ø–ª—ñ–∑"
  example="Hi, we'd like to check in for the flight to London."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Can we sit together?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ–º–æ –º–∏ —Å—ñ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º?"
  pronunciation="–∫–µ–Ω –≤—ñ —Å—ñ—Ç —Ç—É–≥–µ–∑–µ—Ä"
  example="Can we sit together? We're a couple."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Window or aisle seat?"
  translation="–ë—ñ–ª—è –≤—ñ–∫–Ω–∞ —á–∏ –±—ñ–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥—É?"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ–Ω–¥–æ—É –æ—Ä –∞–π–ª —Å—ñ—Ç"
  example="- Window or aisle? - Window, please, so we can enjoy the view together."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We have two bags to check"
  translation="–£ –Ω–∞—Å –¥–≤—ñ –≤–∞–ª—ñ–∑–∏ –¥–ª—è –∑–¥–∞—á—ñ"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ —Ö–µ–≤ —Ç—É –±–µ–≥–∑ —Ç—É —á–µ–∫"
  example="We have two bags to check and two carry-ons."
/>

### –ü–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—å

<VocabCard
  word="We're here on vacation"
  translation="–ú–∏ —Ç—É—Ç —É –≤—ñ–¥–ø—É—Å—Ç—Ü—ñ"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ—Ä —Ö—ñ—Ä –æ–Ω –≤–µ–π–∫–µ–π—à–µ–Ω"
  example="- Purpose of your visit? - We're here on vacation."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We're staying for [X] days/weeks"
  translation="–ú–∏ –∑–∞–ª–∏—à–∞—î–º–æ—Å—å –Ω–∞ [X] –¥–Ω—ñ–≤/—Ç–∏–∂–Ω—ñ–≤"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ—Ä —Å—Ç–µ–π—ñ–Ω–≥ —Ñ–æ—Ä... –¥–µ–π–∑/–≤—ñ–∫—Å"
  example="We're staying for two weeks."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We're staying at [hotel name]"
  translation="–ú–∏ –∑—É–ø–∏–Ω—è—î–º–æ—Å—å —É [–Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞ –≥–æ—Ç–µ–ª—é]"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ—Ä —Å—Ç–µ–π—ñ–Ω–≥ –µ—Ç"
  example="We're staying at the Grand Hotel in the city center."
/>

<CultureTip title="–ü–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—å" flag="üá∫üá∏">
–ù–∞ –ø–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–º—É –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—ñ –≤ –°–®–ê —Ç–∞ –í–µ–ª–∏–∫—ñ–π –ë—Ä–∏—Ç–∞–Ω—ñ—ó –≤—ñ–¥–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∞–π—Ç–µ —á—ñ—Ç–∫–æ —ñ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ. –ù–µ –∂–∞—Ä—Ç—É–π—Ç–µ —ñ –Ω–µ –¥–∞–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ –∑–∞–π–≤–æ—ó —ñ–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ—ó. "Vacation" ‚Äî –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–Ω—è –≤—ñ–¥–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥—å –Ω–∞ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è –ø—Ä–æ –º–µ—Ç—É –≤—ñ–∑–∏—Ç—É.
</CultureTip>

## –£ –≥–æ—Ç–µ–ª—ñ

### –ó–∞—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è (Check-in)

<VocabCard
  word="We have a reservation under [name]"
  translation="–£ –Ω–∞—Å –±—Ä–æ–Ω—é–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞ —ñ–º'—è [—ñ–º'—è]"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ —Ö–µ–≤ –µ —Ä–µ–∑–µ—Ä–≤–µ–π—à–µ–Ω –∞–Ω–¥–µ—Ä"
  example="Good evening. We have a reservation under Shevchenko."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We booked a double room"
  translation="–ú–∏ –∑–∞–±—Ä–æ–Ω—é–≤–∞–ª–∏ –¥–≤–æ–º—ñ—Å–Ω–∏–π –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ –±—É–∫—Ç –µ –¥–∞–±–ª —Ä—É–º"
  example="We booked a double room with a king-size bed."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Is there a room with a better view?"
  translation="–ß–∏ —î –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä –∑ –∫—Ä–∞—â–∏–º –≤–∏–¥–æ–º?"
  pronunciation="—ñ–∑ –∑–µ—Ä –µ —Ä—É–º –≤—ñ–∑ –µ –±–µ—Ç–µ—Ä –≤'—é"
  example="Is there a room with a better view? It's our anniversary."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Could we have a late checkout?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ–º–æ –º–∏ –≤–∏—ó—Ö–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—ñ–∑–Ω—ñ—à–µ?"
  pronunciation="–∫—É–¥ –≤—ñ —Ö–µ–≤ –µ –ª–µ–π—Ç —á–µ–∫–∞—É—Ç"
  example="Could we have a late checkout tomorrow? We have an evening flight."
/>

### –ó–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∏ –≤ –≥–æ—Ç–µ–ª—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="Could we get extra towels?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ–º–æ –º–∏ –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞—Ç–∏ –¥–æ–¥–∞—Ç–∫–æ–≤—ñ —Ä—É—à–Ω–∏–∫–∏?"
  pronunciation="–∫—É–¥ –≤—ñ –≥–µ—Ç –µ–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ —Ç–∞–≤–µ–ª—Å"
  example="Could we get extra towels and bathrobes, please?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Is breakfast included?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –≤–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–π —Å–Ω—ñ–¥–∞–Ω–æ–∫?"
  pronunciation="—ñ–∑ –±—Ä–µ–∫—Ñ–µ—Å—Ç —ñ–Ω–∫–ª—é–¥–µ–¥"
  example="Is breakfast included in our rate?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Could you recommend a romantic restaurant nearby?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –± –≤–∏ –ø–æ—Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–π —Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–Ω –ø–æ–±–ª–∏–∑—É?"
  pronunciation="–∫—É–¥ —é —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥ –µ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç—ñ–∫ —Ä–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω—Ç –Ω—ñ—Ä–±–∞–π"
  example="Could you recommend a romantic restaurant nearby? It's our anniversary."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We need a wake-up call"
  translation="–ù–∞–º –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–µ–Ω –¥–∑–≤—ñ–Ω–æ–∫-–±—É–¥–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–∫"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ –Ω—ñ–¥ –µ –≤–µ–π–∫-–∞–ø –∫–æ–ª"
  example="We need a wake-up call at 7 AM, please."
/>

<CultureTip title="–ß–∞–π–æ–≤—ñ –≤ –≥–æ—Ç–µ–ª—ñ" flag="üá∫üá∏">
–í –°–®–ê –ø—Ä–∏–π–Ω—è—Ç–æ –∑–∞–ª–∏—à–∞—Ç–∏ $1-2 –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–¥—É—à—Ü—ñ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–∫–æ—ó–≤–∫–∏ —â–æ–¥–Ω—è, —Ç–∞ $1-2 –Ω–æ—Å—ñ—é –∑–∞ –∫–æ–∂–Ω—É –≤–∞–ª—ñ–∑—É. –£ –í–µ–ª–∏–∫—ñ–π –ë—Ä–∏—Ç–∞–Ω—ñ—ó —á–∞–π–æ–≤—ñ –º–µ–Ω—à –ø–æ—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω—ñ, –∞–ª–µ –≤—Å–µ –∂ –≤—ñ—Ç–∞—é—Ç—å—Å—è.
</CultureTip>

## –¢—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç

### –¢–∞–∫—Å—ñ/Uber

<VocabCard
  word="Can you take us to [address]?"
  translation="–í–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –≤—ñ–¥–≤–µ–∑—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞—Å –¥–æ [–∞–¥—Ä–µ—Å–∞]?"
  pronunciation="–∫–µ–Ω —é —Ç–µ–π–∫ –∞—Å —Ç—É"
  example="Can you take us to the Eiffel Tower, please?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="How long will it take?"
  translation="–°–∫—ñ–ª—å–∫–∏ —á–∞—Å—É —Ü–µ –∑–∞–π–º–µ?"
  pronunciation="—Ö–∞—É –ª–æ–Ω–≥ –≤—ñ–ª —ñ—Ç —Ç–µ–π–∫"
  example="How long will it take to get to the city center?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Could you wait for us?"
  translation="–í–∏ –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –± –Ω–∞ –Ω–∞—Å –ø–æ—á–µ–∫–∞—Ç–∏?"
  pronunciation="–∫—É–¥ —é –≤–µ–π—Ç —Ñ–æ—Ä –∞—Å"
  example="Could you wait for us? We'll only be 10 minutes."
/>

### –û—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–∞ –∞–≤—Ç–æ

<VocabCard
  word="We'd like to rent a car"
  translation="–ú–∏ —Ö–æ—Ç—ñ–ª–∏ –± –æ—Ä–µ–Ω–¥—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ–¥ –ª–∞–π–∫ —Ç—É —Ä–µ–Ω—Ç –µ –∫–∞—Ä"
  example="We'd like to rent a car for a week."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Is GPS included?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –≤–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–π GPS?"
  pronunciation="—ñ–∑ –¥–∂—ñ-–ø—ñ-–µ—Å —ñ–Ω–∫–ª—é–¥–µ–¥"
  example="Is GPS included? We're not familiar with the area."
/>

## –£ —Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="A table for two, please"
  translation="–°—Ç–æ–ª–∏–∫ –Ω–∞ –¥–≤–æ—Ö, –±—É–¥—å –ª–∞—Å–∫–∞"
  pronunciation="–µ —Ç–µ–π–±–ª —Ñ–æ—Ä —Ç—É, –ø–ª—ñ–∑"
  example="Good evening. A table for two, please. Somewhere quiet."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We're celebrating our anniversary"
  translation="–ú–∏ —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫—É—î–º–æ –Ω–∞—à—É —Ä—ñ—á–Ω–∏—Ü—é"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ—Ä —Å–µ–ª–µ–±—Ä–µ–π—Ç—ñ–Ω–≥ –∞—É—Ä –µ–Ω–Ω—ñ–≤–µ—Ä—Å–µ—Ä—ñ"
  example="We're celebrating our anniversary. Any special recommendations?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Could we have the check, please?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —Ä–∞—Ö—É–Ω–æ–∫, –±—É–¥—å –ª–∞—Å–∫–∞?"
  pronunciation="–∫—É–¥ –≤—ñ —Ö–µ–≤ –∑–µ —á–µ–∫, –ø–ª—ñ–∑"
  example="That was delicious. Could we have the check, please?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Is service included?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –≤–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–µ –æ–±—Å–ª—É–≥–æ–≤—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è?"
  pronunciation="—ñ–∑ —Å–µ—Ä–≤—ñ—Å —ñ–Ω–∫–ª—é–¥–µ–¥"
  example="Is service included in the bill?"
/>

## –ï–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω—ñ —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü—ñ—ó

<VocabCard
  word="We need help"
  translation="–ù–∞–º –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ –Ω—ñ–¥ —Ö–µ–ª–ø"
  example="Excuse me, we need help. We're lost."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We've lost our passports"
  translation="–ú–∏ –∑–∞–≥—É–±–∏–ª–∏ –ø–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ–≤ –ª–æ—Å—Ç –∞—É—Ä –ø–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—Å"
  example="We've lost our passports. Where's the nearest embassy?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Is there a pharmacy nearby?"
  translation="–ß–∏ —î –∞–ø—Ç–µ–∫–∞ –ø–æ–±–ª–∏–∑—É?"
  pronunciation="—ñ–∑ –∑–µ—Ä –µ —Ñ–∞—Ä–º–µ—Å—ñ –Ω—ñ—Ä–±–∞–π"
  example="Is there a pharmacy nearby? My partner isn't feeling well."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We need to see a doctor"
  translation="–ù–∞–º –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–µ–Ω –ª—ñ–∫–∞—Ä"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ –Ω—ñ–¥ —Ç—É —Å—ñ –µ –¥–æ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä"
  example="We need to see a doctor. Where's the nearest hospital?"
/>

<CultureTip title="–ï–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–π –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä" flag="üá¨üáß">
–ó–∞–ø–∞–º'—è—Ç–∞–π—Ç–µ –µ–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω—ñ –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–∏: —É –°–®–ê ‚Äî 911, —É –í–µ–ª–∏–∫—ñ–π –ë—Ä–∏—Ç–∞–Ω—ñ—ó ‚Äî 999, –≤ –ê–≤—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—ñ—ó ‚Äî 000. –û–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç—å –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–æ—é, —Ç–æ–º—É –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ –∑–Ω–∞—Ç–∏ –±–∞–∑–æ–≤—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏.
</CultureTip>

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏ –≤ –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="This view is breathtaking"
  translation="–¶–µ–π –≤–∏–¥ –∑–∞—Ö–æ–ø–ª—é—î –¥—É—Ö"
  pronunciation="–∑—ñ—Å –≤'—é —ñ–∑ –±—Ä–µ–∑—Ç–µ–π–∫—ñ–Ω–≥"
  example="Look at this view! It's breathtaking, isn't it?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I'm so happy we're here together"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–∞–∫ —â–∞—Å–ª–∏–≤–∏–π, —â–æ –º–∏ —Ç—É—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º"
  pronunciation="–∞–π–º —Å–æ—É —Ö–µ–ø–ø—ñ –≤—ñ—Ä —Ö—ñ—Ä —Ç—É–≥–µ–∑–µ—Ä"
  example="I'm so happy we're here together. This is perfect."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Let's take a photo together"
  translation="–î–∞–≤–∞–π —Å—Ñ–æ—Ç–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ—É—î–º–æ—Å—å —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º"
  pronunciation="–ª–µ—Ç—Å —Ç–µ–π–∫ –µ —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ —Ç—É–≥–µ–∑–µ—Ä"
  example="Let's take a photo together in front of this."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Could you take our picture?"
  translation="–ß–∏ –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –± –≤–∏ –Ω–∞—Å —Å—Ñ–æ—Ç–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏?"
  pronunciation="–∫—É–¥ —é —Ç–µ–π–∫ –∞—É—Ä –ø—ñ–∫—á–µ—Ä"
  example="Excuse me, could you take our picture, please?"
/>


## –¢–∞–±–ª–∏—Ü—è –∫–ª—é—á–æ–≤–∏—Ö —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑

| –°–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü—ñ—è | –§—Ä–∞–∑–∞ | –ü–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–¥ |
|----------|-------|----------|
| –ê–µ—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç | Can we sit together? | –ß–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ–º–æ —Å—ñ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º? |
| –ì–æ—Ç–µ–ª—å | We have a reservation | –£ –Ω–∞—Å –±—Ä–æ–Ω—é–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è |
| –†–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–Ω | Table for two | –°—Ç–æ–ª–∏–∫ –Ω–∞ –¥–≤–æ—Ö |
| –¢–∞–∫—Å—ñ | Take us to... | –í—ñ–¥–≤–µ–∑—ñ—Ç—å –Ω–∞—Å –¥–æ... |
| –î–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞ | We need help | –ù–∞–º –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞ |
| –§–æ—Ç–æ | Take our picture? | –°—Ñ–æ—Ç–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ—É—î—Ç–µ –Ω–∞—Å? |

## –ö–æ—Ä–∏—Å–Ω—ñ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂–µ–π

| –ê–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ |
|------------|------------|
| Passport | –ü–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç |
| Boarding pass | –ü–æ—Å–∞–¥–∫–æ–≤–∏–π —Ç–∞–ª–æ–Ω |
| Luggage/Baggage | –ë–∞–≥–∞–∂ |
| Reservation | –ë—Ä–æ–Ω—é–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è |
| Check-in/Check-out | –ó–∞—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è/–í–∏—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è |
| Receipt | –ß–µ–∫, –∫–≤–∏—Ç–∞–Ω—Ü—ñ—è |
| Currency exchange | –û–±–º—ñ–Ω –≤–∞–ª—é—Ç |
| ATM | –ë–∞–Ω–∫–æ–º–∞—Ç |

<CTA

articles.title: Orosz sz√ºlet√©snapi k√≠v√°ns√°gok p√°rodnak
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

A p√°rod sz√ºlet√©snapja t√∂k√©letes alkalom, hogy megmutasd, mennyire szereted. Ha oroszul szeretn√©l sz√≠vb≈ël j√∂v≈ë k√≠v√°ns√°gokat mondani, ezek a kifejez√©sek seg√≠tenek.

Az alapvet≈ë szerelmi kifejez√©sek√©rt n√©zd meg a [Hogyan mondd: Szeretlek oroszul](/learn/hu/ru/russian-how-to-say-i-love-you) cikk√ºnket.

## Alapvet≈ë sz√≥kincs

## Hasznos kifejez√©sek

## Gyakorlati helyzetek

articles.title: Expresii √Æn GermanƒÉ pentru Discu»õii »ôi Dezacorduri √Æn Cuplu
articles.content:
Germanii sunt cunoscu»õi pentru directitatea »ôi eficien»õa lor, iar aceste calitƒÉ»õi se reflectƒÉ »ôi √Æn modul √Æn care abordeazƒÉ conflictele √Æn rela»õii. DacƒÉ partenerul tƒÉu vorbe»ôte germanƒÉ, √Æn»õelegerea modului √Æn care sƒÉ-»õi exprimi dezacordurile √Æn limba lui te va ajuta sƒÉ rezolvi problemele √Æntr-un mod clar »ôi constructiv.

## Abordarea GermanƒÉ a Conflictului

√én cultura germanƒÉ, comunicarea directƒÉ este apreciatƒÉ »ôi a»ôteptatƒÉ. Germanii preferƒÉ sƒÉ abordeze problemele frontal, fƒÉrƒÉ a le ocoli. Acest lucru poate pƒÉrea dur pentru cei obi»ônui»õi cu stiluri de comunicare mai indirecte, dar este de fapt un semn de respect - partenerul tƒÉu presupune cƒÉ e»ôti suficient de matur pentru a auzi adevƒÉrul.

## Expresii Esen»õiale pentru Discu»õii

### Exprimarea FrustrƒÉrii

**"Ich f√ºhle mich frustriert, wenn..."**
*MƒÉ simt frustrat/ƒÉ c√¢nd...*
Formularea "Ich" (eu) men»õine focusul pe sentimentele tale.

**"Wir m√ºssen √ºber etwas Wichtiges reden."**
*Trebuie sƒÉ vorbim despre ceva important.*
O introducere clarƒÉ »ôi directƒÉ, a»ôa cum germanii apreciazƒÉ.

**"Das verletzt mich."**
*Asta mƒÉ rƒÉne»ôte.*
Exprimarea directƒÉ a durerii emo»õionale.

### Cererea de ClarificƒÉri

**"Was meinst du damit?"**
*Ce vrei sƒÉ spui cu asta?*
O √Æntrebare simplƒÉ »ôi directƒÉ pentru clarificare.

**"Hilf mir, deinen Standpunkt zu verstehen."**
*AjutƒÉ-mƒÉ sƒÉ √Æn»õeleg punctul tƒÉu de vedere.*
AratƒÉ dorin»õa de a √Æn»õelege perspectiva celuilalt.

**"Kannst du das genauer erkl√§ren?"**
*Po»õi explica asta mai detaliat?*
Ceri informa»õii suplimentare √Ænainte de a reac»õiona.

### Stabilirea Limitelor

**"Ich brauche einen Moment, um nachzudenken."**
*Am nevoie de un moment sƒÉ mƒÉ g√¢ndesc.*
Germanii respectƒÉ nevoia de procesare.

**"Lass uns sachlich bleiben."**
*SƒÉ rƒÉm√¢nem obiectivi.*
O reamintire sƒÉ nu lƒÉsa»õi emo»õiile sƒÉ preia controlul.

**"So m√∂chte ich nicht angesprochen werden."**
*Nu vreau sƒÉ mi se vorbeascƒÉ a»ôa.*
Stabile»ôti o limitƒÉ clarƒÉ despre modul de comunicare.

### Recunoa»ôterea »ôi Concesiile

**"Da hast du Recht."**
*Ai dreptate aici.*
Recunoa»ôterea simplƒÉ »ôi directƒÉ c√¢nd partenerul are dreptate.

**"Das h√§tte ich nicht sagen sollen."**
*N-ar fi trebuit sƒÉ spun asta.*
Recunoa»ôterea gre»ôelii fƒÉrƒÉ justificƒÉri.

**"Ich verstehe, warum du ver√§rgert bist."**
*√én»õeleg de ce e»ôti supƒÉrat/ƒÉ.*
Validezi emo»õiile partenerului.

### CƒÉutarea Solu»õiilor

**"Wie k√∂nnen wir das gemeinsam l√∂sen?"**
*Cum putem rezolva asta √ÆmpreunƒÉ?*
Abordarea orientatƒÉ spre solu»õii, tipic germanƒÉ.

**"Was brauchst du jetzt von mir?"**
*Ce ai nevoie de la mine acum?*
Interes concret pentru nevoile partenerului.

**"Lass uns einen Kompromiss finden."**
*SƒÉ gƒÉsim un compromis.*
Propunere practicƒÉ de rezolvare.

## Nuan»õe Culturale Importante

### Directitatea ca Respect
√én Germania, a spune lucrurilor pe nume nu este nepoliticos - este onest. Nu te a»ôtepta ca partenerul sƒÉ "citeascƒÉ printre r√¢nduri".

### Structura »ôi Planificarea
Germanii apreciazƒÉ discu»õiile structurate. DacƒÉ ai mai multe probleme de discutat, poate fi util sƒÉ le abordezi pe r√¢nd.

### Separarea Problemei de PersoanƒÉ
Germanii pot critica o ac»õiune fƒÉrƒÉ a critica persoana. √éncearcƒÉ sƒÉ nu iei totul personal.

## Expresii de Evitat

- **"Du machst immer..."** (Tu faci mereu...) - EvitƒÉ generalizƒÉrile
- **"Das ist mir egal"** (Nu-mi pasƒÉ) - AratƒÉ dezinteres total
- **"Sei nicht so empfindlich"** (Nu fi a»ôa sensibil/ƒÉ) - InvalideazƒÉ emo»õiile partenerului

## Sfaturi Practice

1. **Fii direct dar nu brutal** - Germanii apreciazƒÉ onestitatea, dar nu cruzimea
2. **ConcentreazƒÉ-te pe fapte** - PrezintƒÉ situa»õia clar, cu exemple concrete
3. **RespectƒÉ timpul** - DacƒÉ stabili»õi sƒÉ discuta»õi mai t√¢rziu, respectƒÉ programul
4. **OferƒÉ solu»õii** - Nu doar critica; vino cu propuneri constructive
5. **Scuzele sunt importante** - "Es tut mir leid" (√émi pare rƒÉu) are greutate c√¢nd este sincer

## Concluzie

A gestiona conflictele √Æn germanƒÉ cu partenerul necesitƒÉ directitate »ôi claritate. Cu aceste expresii, vei putea comunica eficient chiar »ôi √Æn momentele dificile. Aminte»ôte-»õi cƒÉ stilul german de comunicare, de»ôi poate pƒÉrea rece la √Ænceput, este de fapt construit pe respect »ôi dorin»õa de a rezolva problemele √Æntr-un mod eficient.

articles.title: Expressions de Mariage en Hongrois : Guide Complet
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Le mariage est l'un des moments les plus magiques de la vie d'un couple. Si vous vous mariez dans un pays hongroisphone, ou si vous avez des invit√©s qui parlent hongrois, ce guide vous aidera √† ma√Ætriser tout le vocabulaire essentiel. D√©couvrez les expressions les plus importantes pour vivre pleinement ce jour sp√©cial en hongrois.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Hozz√°m j√∂ssz feles√©g√ºl?"
  translation="Veux-tu m'√©pouser ?"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  context="La question la plus importante de votre vie - la demande en mariage"
/>

## Les Bases : F√©licitations aux Mari√©s

<VocabCard
  word="Gratul√°lok az esk√ºv≈ëh√∂z!"
  translation="F√©licitations pour votre mariage !"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Gratul√°lok az esk√ºv≈ëh√∂z! √âljenek boldogan, am√≠g meg nem halnak!"
/>

### Expressions de F√©licitations

| Hongrois | Fran√ßais | Contexte |
|---------|----------|----------|
| Gratul√°lok az esk√ºv≈ëh√∂z! | F√©licitations pour votre mariage ! | Universel |
| √âljenek boldogan, am√≠g meg nem halnak | Que vous viviez heureux pour toujours ! | Romantique |

<CultureTip title="Traditions de Mariage" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Dans les pays hongroisphones, les traditions de mariage varient selon les r√©gions. Le toast aux mari√©s est un moment important de la c√©l√©bration o√π famille et amis partagent leurs v≈ìux de bonheur.
</CultureTip>

## Vocabulaire de la C√©r√©monie

<VocabCard
  word="Igen, akarom"
  translation="Oui, je le veux"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Quand on lui a demand√©, il/elle a r√©pondu : 'Igen, akarom'."
/>

### Les Participants au Mariage

| Hongrois | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|
| menyasszony | la mari√©e |
| v≈ëleg√©ny | le mari√© |
| koszor√∫sl√°ny | demoiselle d'honneur |
| tan√∫ | t√©moin du mari√© |
| esk√ºv≈ë | mariage |
| szertart√°s | c√©r√©monie |
| fogad√°s | r√©ception |
| n√°sz√∫t | lune de miel |

### Les √âl√©ments de la C√©r√©monie

| Hongrois | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|
| fogadalmak | v≈ìux de mariage |
| jegygy≈±r≈± | alliance |
| csokor | bouquet |
| folyos√≥ | all√©e centrale |
| olt√°r | autel |
| f√°tyol | voile |
| esk√ºv≈ëi torta | g√¢teau de mariage |
| nyit√≥t√°nc | premi√®re danse |

<VocabCard
  word="jegygy≈±r≈±"
  translation="alliance"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Les jegygy≈±r≈± symbolisent l'amour √©ternel."
/>

## La Demande en Mariage

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Hozz√°m j√∂ssz feles√©g√ºl?"
  translation="Veux-tu m'√©pouser ?"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  context="La question la plus romantique"
/>

### Vocabulaire des Fian√ßailles

| Hongrois | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|
| l√°nyk√©r√©s | demande en mariage |
| eljegyz√©s | fian√ßailles |
| menyasszony | fianc√©(e) |

<CultureTip title="La Demande en Mariage" flag="üá≠üá∫">
La demande en mariage est un moment unique. En hongrois, la phrase traditionnelle "Hozz√°m j√∂ssz feles√©g√ºl?" est souvent accompagn√©e de rituels romantiques comme mettre un genou √† terre.
</CultureTip>

## Messages pour Cartes de Mariage

<VocabCard
  word="√âljenek boldogan, am√≠g meg nem halnak"
  translation="Que vous viviez heureux pour toujours"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Message parfait pour une carte de mariage."
/>

### Formules de V≈ìux

- **Gratul√°lok az esk√ºv≈ëh√∂z!** - F√©licitations pour votre mariage !
- **√âljenek boldogan, am√≠g meg nem halnak** - Que vous viviez heureux pour toujours !

## La R√©ception

### Vocabulaire de la F√™te

| Hongrois | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|

| esk√ºv≈ëi torta | g√¢teau de mariage |
| nyit√≥t√°nc | premi√®re danse |
| poh√°rk√∂sz√∂nt≈ë | toast |
| csokor | bouquet |

<VocabCard
  word="poh√°rk√∂sz√∂nt≈ë"
  translation="toast"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Le t√©moin a port√© un poh√°rk√∂sz√∂nt≈ë aux mari√©s."
/>

## Pour Aller Plus Loin

Maintenant que vous ma√Ætrisez le vocabulaire du mariage en hongrois, pourquoi ne pas explorer d'autres expressions romantiques ? D√©couvrez nos guides sur les [expressions romantiques en hongrois](/fr/blog/hungarian-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion) ou les [petits noms affectueux](/fr/blog/hungarian-pet-names-terms-of-endearment).

Que vous disiez "Igen, akarom" bient√¥t ou que vous f√™tiez le mariage d'un proche, ces expressions vous permettront de partager pleinement la joie de ce moment unique.

articles.title: 30+ Piropos en ingl√©s: Cumplidos para Enamorar a tu Pareja
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

Los cumplidos son peque√±os regalos verbales que pueden alegrar el d√≠a de tu pareja. Decirlos en ingl√©s los hace a√∫n m√°s especiales y demuestra tu compromiso con aprender su idioma. Aqu√≠ tienes m√°s de 30 piropos perfectos para diferentes ocasiones.

<PhraseOfDay

## Cumplidos Sobre la Apariencia

### Belleza General

| ingl√©s | Espa√±ol | Pronunciaci√≥n |
|-------------|---------|---------------|
| **Eres hermosa** | Eres hermosa | [pron] |
| **Eres guapo** | Eres guapo | [pron] |

### Caracter√≠sticas Espec√≠ficas

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="El arte del piropo en ingl√©s">
En la cultura inglesa, los cumplidos tienen sus propias reglas. Ser sincero y espec√≠fico es m√°s valorado que los halagos gen√©ricos.
</CultureTip>

## Cumplidos Sobre la Personalidad

| ingl√©s | Espa√±ol | Pronunciaci√≥n |
|-------------|---------|---------------|
| **Eres muy inteligente** | Eres muy inteligente | [pron] |
| **Me encanta tu sentido del humor** | Me encanta tu sentido del humor | [pron] |

| **Tienes un coraz√≥n de oro** | Tienes un coraz√≥n de oro | [pron] |
| **Admiro tu fortaleza** | Admiro tu fortaleza | [pron] |
| **Eres la persona m√°s genuina** | Eres la persona m√°s genuina | [pron] |

## Cumplidos Rom√°nticos

| ingl√©s | Espa√±ol | Pronunciaci√≥n |
|-------------|---------|---------------|
| **Me haces feliz** | Me haces feliz | [pron] |

| **Soy afortunado/a de tenerte** | Soy afortunado/a de tenerte | [pron] |
